revised_title: Electroviscous Effect for Suspensions of Solid Spherical Particles
tldr: The authors investigate the electroviscous effect, which is the increase in viscosity of a suspension of solid, spherical, charged non-conducting particles in an electrolyte due to the surface charge and the ionic double layer surrounding the particles. They provide a general formula for the effective viscosity and show that the electroviscous contribution to the viscosity tends to increase as the thickness of the double layer increases. The study improves the agreement with experimental data.
